definition[0]: when one company takes control of another by buying more than half its shares
example[0]: Thornbury has announced a takeover bid of a regional TV company.
example[1]: He prevented a hostile takeover  (=when the takeover is not wanted by the company being bought) of the company.
definition[1]: an act of getting control of a country or political organization, using force
definition[2]: the act of getting control of a company by buying over 50% of its shares
example[3]: To avoid a takeover, the investment company went deeply in debt to pay a huge special dividend.
example[4]: There was a takeover bid by a larger and more aggressive company.
example[5]: an anti-takeover plan  (=one to try and avoid a takeover)
